channel.title: Storing Game Assets(Models, images etc.)
channel.description:
Hello everyone, I've been writing a 2-D game that has quite a bit of game resources and I was thinking of a way to load all of the data.
My first idea was a cache system like Runescape where you store different assets in different indexes.
But I have no idea how I could create something like this. Can someone provide a sample snippet?

item.title: Storing Game Assets(Models, images etc.)
item.dc:creator: @cedia cedia
item.description:
@cedia wrote:

Davidi2:

Yup, sprite sheets and tile sets. Simple to load and store, you can chose to compress them if you wish. I have some snippets in my 2d map editor if you care to look (I can’t guarantee the quality, it was written a few years ago, but you can get the idea), and there’s some tile sets in the download there as well.

Ok Thanks a lot you two

Read full topic

item.title: Storing Game Assets(Models, images etc.)
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Sprite sheet for 2d assets. Google it, real simple. Alternatively you could store each image in its own file and load it that way.

Read full topic
